snippet: Fifty years after independence, Jamaica should revise its fictive national motto, rejecting the homogenizing myth of multicultural assimilation.
abstract: Op-Ed article by literary and cultural studies Prof Carolyn Cooper, on the occasion of Jamaica's fiftieth anniversary of independence, calls for the national motto of Jamaica, 'Out of many, one people,' to be changed; contends that the motto perpetuates a homogenizing myth of multicultural assimilation.
lead_paragraph: Fifty years after independence, Jamaica should revise its fictive national motto, rejecting the homogenizing myth of multicultural assimilation.
